question: 馬力
sourceMnemonic: This word was probably made pretty recently. A <kanji>horse</kanji>'s <kanji>power</kanji>? That is <vocabulary>horsepower</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>力</ja> has two common on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

Cars with high <vocabulary>horsepower</vocabulary> are usually driven by <reading>Ricky</reading> (<ja>りき</ja>). Ricky is well-known for loving all cars with a lot of horsepower, so he's often seen driving around in fancy sports cars. Vroom vroom Ricky!
